creator.name: Gemengd Gerechtshof tot wering van de slavenhandel
creator.name_english: Joint English and Dutch Court for the prevention of slave trade
creator.his_func:
In 1808 the slave trade was abolished in the British colonies. This decision also applied to Suriname, which was under British rule at that time. The measure was maintained under British pressure in 1814 when Suriname was restored to Dutch rule again.
In May 1818 a special treaty was concluded between Great Britain and the Netherlands for the supervision of the illegal slave trade. Two joint courts were created for the punishment of offenders. One of these two courts was established in Paramaribo. Both countries provided for two commissioners, and these judges were asked to report regularly.
